body.p: The undersigned citizens of the County of Caldwell would respectfully represent that R. H. Johnson, who is now in confinement in the Penitentiary under a conviction for mayhem inflicted on his wife, is in their opinion entitled to the intervention of your Excellency We believe that the punishment he has suffered is fully equal to the demands of justice under the circumstances of his conviction. He is the head of a dependant and helpless family without whose aid want and suffering must subject to the cold charities of an unfriendly world. His offense against the laws of the land and the good order of society was the result, not of criminal purpose, so much as the unfortunate influence of inebriation, and the demands of justice for the crime are adequately satisfied by the punishment he has already received.
Wherefore in consideration of the premises we respectfully ask the interposition of that mercy confided to your Excellency by the constitution and laws of the land -- in his behalf.

Mrs. Sophi Johnson
